intro: Eriocaulon lanceolatum var. bhatkalense, commonly known as the Bhatkal grass, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern India. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or saline soils along the shorelines, showcasing its adaptability to coastal environments. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets that are densely packed, contributing to its ornamental appeal. This variety is notable for its ecological significance in stabilizing dune ecosystems and supporting local biodiversity.
